scriptures.content: God said to Jacob, "Arise, go up to <crossref let="b" cid="c01035001.1"/>Bethel and dwell there. Make an altar there to the God who appeared to you <crossref let="c" cid="c01035001.2"/>when you fled from your brother Esau. "

So Jacob said to his <crossref let="d" cid="c01035002.1"/>household and to all who were with him, "Put away <crossref let="e" cid="c01035002.2"/>the foreign gods that are among you and <crossref let="f" cid="c01035002.3"/>purify yourselves and change your garments.

Then let us arise and go up to Bethel, so that I may make there an altar to the God <crossref let="g" cid="c01035003.1"/>who answers me in the day of my distress and <crossref let="h" cid="c01035003.2"/>has been with me wherever I have gone. "
So they gave to Jacob all the foreign gods that they had, and the rings that were in their ears. Jacob hid them under <crossref let="i" cid="c01035004.1"/>the terebinth tree that was near Shechem.
And as they journeyed, a terror from God fell upon the cities that were around them, so that they did not pursue the sons of Jacob.
And Jacob came to <crossref let="j" cid="c01035006.1"/>Luz (that is, Bethel), which is in the land of Canaan, he and all the people who were with him,
and there he built an altar and called the place El-bethel,El-bethel means God of Bethel because there God had revealed himself to him when he fled from his brother.
And Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died, and she was buried under an oak below Bethel. So he called its name Allon-bacuth. Allon-bacuth means oak of weeping
God appearedOr had appeared to Jacob again, when he came from Paddan-aram, and blessed him.

And God said to him, "Your name is Jacob; <crossref let="m" cid="c01035010.1"/>no longer shall your name be called Jacob, but <crossref let="n" cid="c01035010.2"/>Israel shall be your name. " So he called his name Israel.

And God said to him, "I am God Almighty:Hebrew El Shaddai be fruitful and multiply. A nation and a company of nations shall come from you, and kings shall come from your own body. Hebrew from your loins
<crossref let="r" cid="c01035012.1"/>The land that I gave to Abraham and Isaac I will give to you, and I will give the land to your offspring after you. "
Then God <crossref let="s" cid="c01035013.1"/>went up from him in the place where he had spoken with him.
And Jacob <crossref let="t" cid="c01035014.1"/>set up a pillar in the place where he had spoken with him, a pillar of stone. He poured out a drink offering on it and poured oil on it.
So Jacob called the name of the place where God had spoken with him <crossref let="u" cid="c01035015.1"/>Bethel.
Then they journeyed from Bethel. When they were still some distanceOr about two hours' distance from Ephrath, Rachel went into labor, and she had hard labor.
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: And when her labor was at its hardest, the midwife said to her, "Do not fear, for <crossref let="v" cid="c01035017.1"/>you have another son. "
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: And as her soul was departing (for she was dying), she called his name Ben-oni;Ben-oni could mean son of my sorrow, or son of my strength but his father called him Benjamin. Benjamin means son of the right hand
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: So <crossref let="x" cid="c01035019.1"/>Rachel died, and she was buried on the way to <crossref let="y" cid="c01035019.2"/>Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem),
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: and Jacob set up a pillar over her tomb. It is <crossref let="z" cid="c01035020.1"/>the pillar of Rachel's tomb, which is there to this day.
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: Israel journeyed on and pitched his tent beyond the tower of Eder.
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: While Israel lived in that land, Reuben went and <crossref let="a" cid="c01035022.1"/>lay with Bilhah his father's concubine. And Israel heard of it. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve.
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: The sons of Leah: <crossref let="b" cid="c01035023.1"/>Reuben (Jacob's firstborn), Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: The sons of Bilhah, Rachel's servant: Dan and Naphtali.
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: The sons of Zilpah, Leah's servant: Gad and Asher. These were the sons of Jacob who were born to him in Paddan-aram.
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: And Jacob came to his father Isaac at <crossref let="c" cid="c01035027.1"/>Mamre, or <crossref let="d" cid="c01035027.2"/>Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac had sojourned.
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: Now the days of Isaac were 180 years.
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

scriptures.content: And Isaac breathed his last, and he died <crossref let="e" cid="c01035029.1"/>and was gathered to his people, old and full of days. And <crossref let="f" cid="c01035029.2"/>his sons Esau and Jacob buried him. <end-chapter/>
scriptures.section_title: The Deaths of Rachel and Isaac

n01035018.1.content: Ben-oni could mean son of my sorrow, or son of my strength

n01035018.2.content: Benjamin means son of the right hand
